what: Estimate weights to reduce bias due to selection — estimate_selection_weights
title: Estimate weights to reduce bias due to selection — estimate_selection_weights
text: main function estimate balancing weights reduction bias due selection (e.g., loss follow-). essentially wrapper around weightit function. Please refer documentation details. Essentially, function takes input dataset formula describing selection process might depend chosen covariates. estimate weights distribution covariates among selected non-selected subjects similar. weights can finally used functions fit regression models (e.g. weights parameter glm function). formula passed input, function simply create main-effects formula (e.g., interactions). information can found specialized texts, like Hernán, M.. Robins, J.M., 2010. Causal inference.

title: Estimate weights to reduce bias due to selection — estimate_selection_weights
code: estimate_selection_weights(   dat,   id_str,   ids_not_censored,   formula,   method_estimation,   link_function,   stabilized,   winsorization,   estimate_by,   sampling_weights,   moments,   interactions,   library_sl,   cv_control_sl,   discrete_sl )

title: Estimate weights to reduce bias due to selection — estimate_selection_weights
text: dat dataset containing column identifier, covariates used estimating weights. dataframe. id_str string indicating name column dat contains identifiers. string. ids_not_censored vector identifiers corresponding subjects censored. , subjects selected e.g., follow-. must subset identifiers contained id_str column dat. vector. formula string representing formula passed weightit. must form "covariate_1 + ...". can include interactions functions individual covariates (e.g., cubic spline). string. method_estimation type model fit estimate balancing weights. must supported WeightIt R package. list specific estimation methods can found . string. link_function link used generalized linear model propensity scores. glm used estimate balancing weights, simply model link function (e.g., logit). string. stabilized methods estimate propensity scores, whether stabilize weights . , whether multiply individual weights proportion subjects treatment group. boolean. discrete_sl

title: Generate a random dataset — generate_fake_data
text: num_rows number rows add. positive integer. num_numeric_cols number numerical variables add. positive integer. num_factor_cols number categorical variables add. positive integer. id_str string indicating IDs. string.

title: Generate a random dataset — generate_fake_data
